docs.lead_paragraph: Depending on how far north you live, your local farmers’ markets may still offer a great mix of of greens in September and early October.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nickelodeon's eight-year-old Worldwide Day of Play is going big time this year. On Saturday, Nickelodeon, the children's television network, will for the first time take its annual event to Washington. To be held on the Ellipse, this year's day of games and activities will bring together more than two dozen of the network's stars and characters, and will include a concert by the boy band Big Time Rush, stars of the Nickelodeon series of the same name.

docs.lead_paragraph: A dozen public schools in Chicago have votes to restore recess in response to a push by parents, advocacy groups and some city officials to bring more exercise and better nutrition to children.

docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS - You're reminded hourly, even while walking along the slow-moving Seine or staring at sculpted marble bodies under the Louvre's high ceilings, that the old continent is crumbling. They're slouching toward a gerontocracy, these Europeans. Their banks are teetering. They can't handle immigration. Greece is broke, and three other nations are not far behind. In a half-dozen languages, the papers shout: crisis!
docs.abstract: Why aren't the French as fat as they should be?
docs.snippet: Why aren't the French as fat as they should be?

headline.main: New Evidence for an Apple a Day

docs.abstract: The old adage promoting an apple a day for better health just got a boost from science. A large Dutch study has found that eating apples and pears is associated with a lower risk of stroke.
docs.snippet: The old adage promoting an apple a day for better health just got a boost from science. A large Dutch study has found that eating apples and pears is associated with a lower risk of stroke.
